page.title: 10A Trip to Minack, St. Levan
page.content: On Thursday we went to Minack Theatre to see Seven Brides for Seven Brothers. There was a queue. It opened at six thirty, we went down the steps and a lady told everybody where to sit. We sat on the first seats. We said to Debbie to get the pasties from the carpark. She took ages to get down the steps. The pasties were lovely. We sat on a sleeping bag and put blankets around us, we also watched fulmars and gannets out at sea. There were also cormorants diving. In the middle of the play we had a bit of drizzle, then it began to rain quite a bit. Once a saw a fulmar go by during the play. I thought the best bit of the play was when Adam stopped and the brothers bumped into him. I couldn't stop laughing. The rain was coming down heavier. The play finished at 10-15pm. I enjoyed myself.
